definition: to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]

sentences.english: The new law discriminates between people employed in the same firm.
sentences.chinese: 新法规对在同一公司工作的人不一视同仁。

sentences.english: Heaven and earth do not act emotional, of all things equally.
sentences.chinese: 天地不情感用事，对万物一视同仁。

sentences.english: There is no..You're like everybody else in my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 别误会，我对大家一视同仁。
迈克喜爱孩子，一视同仁。

sentences.english: I say I am yet too young to understand that God is any respecter of person.
sentences.chinese: 我说，我还太年轻，难以理解上帝为什么不一视同仁。

sentences.english: The management probably equates fewer artifacts with less discipline.
sentences.chinese: 管理层可能将较少的工件与较少的原则一视同仁。

sentences.english: The Muse does not inspire all poets equally.
sentences.chinese: 诗神并不一视同仁地赐予所有诗人以灵感。

sentences.english: When dealing with this matter, he disregarded social status and treated everyone equally.
sentences.chinese: 处理这个事情，他不论尊卑一视同仁。

sentences.english: Death is no respecter of wealth.
sentences.chinese: 死神不问贫富，一视同仁。

sentences.english: God or Life is no respecter of persons.
sentences.chinese: 上帝对任何人都一视同仁。

sentences.english: Equal the thickness of the book, to not feel comfortable appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 书的厚度一视同仁，以不感到舒适为宜。

definition: lit. to hold a bowl of water level (idiom)/fig. to be impartial
to favour one and discriminate against the other
to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
to bare one shoulder/(fig.) to side with/to discriminate in favor of
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to regard the same as/to regard as being the same as
